posts.content:
AI: The Invisible Hand Guiding Davos 2025‚Äôs Legacy 
 
 Davos 2025 isn‚Äôt just about who‚Äôs in the room‚Äîit‚Äôs about who‚Äôs in the network.
Virtual DAVOS uses AI to turn the summit‚Äôs dialogue into a self-sustaining ecosystem:

 Smart Resource Allocation: AI pinpoints regions needing climate tech, matching them with startups and grants.

 Health Equity Engine: Predict outbreaks (like Marburg) and auto-mobilize labs, NGOs, and logistics partners.

 Trust Through Transparency: Public AI dashboards track Davos pledges‚Äîcarbon cuts, SDG progress‚Äîin real time.

The result? A living, learning network that outlasts any summit.

 Join the ecosystem:

posts.name:
Lauren Kelley
Lauren Kelley
posts.content:
At OPEXEngine, we‚Äôre expanding to help our clients be better prepared to meet the exciting (and challenging) opportunities of today's SaaS, Cloud and AI markets. I'm thrilled to announce that we've made some exciting additions to our executive leadership team.

We are delighted to announce the appointment ofas CEO and General Manager of OPEXEngine. Katherine will lead the OPEXEngine team to evolve and scale the organization. She brings deep experience in SaaS strategy and go-to-market operations, having built teams at leading tech companies including Dell and Relativity and starting her career at Bain & Company. Her extensive experience delivering operational excellence during periods of growth and strategic realignment will enhance OPEXEngine‚Äôs ability to deliver actionable results and value for our customers through our benchmarking analyses.

In addition,has joined OPEXEngine as the VP of Benchmarking Strategy and Operations. He will focus on delivering high-impact benchmarking data and analyses to drive value for our customers. Adrian joins us from LegalZoom, where he led Strategic Finance for Sales & Marketing. His work centered on optimizing go-to-market strategy, enhancing financial planning to support growth, and streamlining commercial operations for efficiency. Prior to LegalZoom, Kochan served as a manager at Bain & Company.

I'm excited to shift my work from running OPEXEngine on a daily basis after almost 20 years to a new strategic role in Bain as Chief Evangelist for OPEXEngine and part of the Bain Advisory Network.  Bring it on, 2025!
posts.commentAdded: Congratulations to Katherine and Adrian on their new roles! Exciting times ahead for OPEXEngine as you navigate the future of SaaS and AI!

posts.name:
Matthew Archer
Matthew Archer
posts.content:
You already know‚Äîsilence doesn‚Äôt mean agreement. 

It means avoidance. And it‚Äôs killing your momentum.

For leaders driving high-stakes initiatives, fake consensus isn‚Äôt just frustrating‚Äîit‚Äôs a risk that can derail entire projects.

Let‚Äôs break down why fake consensus happens‚Äîand how to stop it before it stalls your plans.

3 Ways to Fix Fake Consensus:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Invite Dissent ‚Äì Don‚Äôt ask, ‚ÄúDoes everyone agree?‚Äù Instead, ask:
‚ñ™Ô∏è ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs missing?‚Äù
‚ñ™Ô∏è ‚ÄúWhat concerns do you have?‚Äù
‚ñ™Ô∏è ‚ÄúWhat could go wrong?‚Äù

Surface issues early‚Äîbefore they become roadblocks.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Document Decisions ‚Äì Lock in roles, deadlines, and deliverables.
‚ñ™Ô∏è No more assumptions.
‚ñ™Ô∏è No more, ‚ÄúI thought someone else was handling that.‚Äù

3Ô∏è‚É£ Clarify Accountability ‚Äì Make ownership crystal clear:
‚ñ™Ô∏è Who‚Äôs doing what?
‚ñ™Ô∏è By when?
‚ñ™Ô∏è How will we know it‚Äôs done?

Ambiguity kills execution. Precision drives results.

Been There, Fixed That. I‚Äôve led teams that looked aligned‚Äîuntil the wheels fell off.

The fix?
 Set clear expectations upfront.
 Give people time to process and respond.
 Hold everyone ruthlessly accountable for commitments.

Ready to turn alignment into action?

Let‚Äôs talk‚Äîor drop your questions in the comments below!

comments.commentText: Love the visual of this on fake consensus:)
Adam it's how it feels when it happens - usually mid-air and there is no way to safely land it.

posts.commentAdded: Great insights! Inviting dissent and clarifying accountability are game changers. Lets foster true alignment for stronger outcomes!

posts.content:
How I tell people to get started on LinkedIn:

‚Üí Figure out your mission
‚Üí Decide what your goals are
‚Üí Decipher who your target audience is
‚Üí Write your first post (or if posting freaks you out, start commenting on other posts)

How I personally got started on LinkedIn:

‚Üí Was desperately in need of a job before finishing uni
‚Üí Discovered personal branding was a thing
‚Üí Decided to give it a go
‚Üí Landed a job*

We‚Äôre all just winging it on here, so don‚Äôt be shy‚Ä¶come and join us 

*- as I‚Äôve said over and over, this did not happen overnight! It actually took about 5 months of posting before I started working.

posts.name:
Leslie Venetz
Leslie Venetz
posts.content:
Your emails are why the unsubscribe button exists.

Good news, bad news situation - 

Bad news - The bar for writing a decent email is in h*ll.
Good news - It's easy to step over.


Ô∏è EASY FIX -

Replace "I hope you're well" with relevant preview text.

Preview text is the first 30-80 characters of your email. This includes the subject line.

I round it out to 10 words to make it easy on myself.

The fix - Make sure the first 10 words of every email (inclusive of the subject line) say something that makes the prospect think - hmmmmm I'd like to see more.

Spoiler: It will NEVER be "I hope this email finds you well."


 How do you optimize for cold sales email opens?

comments.commentText: didn't know people still use this in cold emails. Preview shall always be about a specific outcome, social proof, trusted connection, or problem solved.

posts.commentAdded: Great tip! Crafting compelling preview text can truly set your email apart. It‚Äôs all about sparking curiosity! üí° Whats your go-to opening line?

TO ALL U.S. COLLEGE STUDENTS:

Mercor is hiring **Campus Growth Strategists** at universities across the country to help us drive user growth as interns this semester.

We have created thousands of jobs on our platform, and now we want to work with the greatest students in America to create millions. As a Campus Growth Strategist, you'll ideate and execute strategies to scale the number of PhDs, grad students, and experienced software engineers hired through our platform.

*BENEFITS*
- $$$ for each successful referral
- Free merch
- Monthly meetings with Mercor leadership
- Trip to SF for top performers

Mercor is one of the fastest-growing startups in Silicon Valley. We're backed by Peter Thiel, Jack Dorsey, Larry Summers, Adam D'Angelo, and more.

We're looking for true hustlers who are creative, ambitious, and able to work as interns while in school this spring. If this describes you, DM me on why you're a good fit.
